A set is a collection of distinct objects considered as an entity.

The Klein four-group, denoted as $\mathfrak{V}_{4}$, is a subgroup of $\mathfrak{S}_{4}$ consisting of the permutations $\{\mathrm{id}, (1,2)(3,4), (1,3)(2,4), (1,4)(2,3)\}$. It is isomorphic to $\mathbb{Z} / 2 \mathbb{Z} \times \mathbb{Z} / 2 \mathbb{Z}$.
Does the concept of a/an Set need to be defined for a definition of a/an Klein Four-Group to make sense? (True if the first concept is needed and False if is not.)
